segments.en: Linked Discourses 43
2. The Second Chapter
12. The Unconditioned
“Mendicants, I will teach you the unconditioned and the path that leads to the unconditioned.
Listen …
And what is the unconditioned?
The ending of greed, hate, and delusion.
This is called the unconditioned.
And what is the path that leads to the unconditioned?
Serenity.
This is called the path that leads to the unconditioned.

segments.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, desitaṃ vo mayā asaṅkhataṃ, desito asaṅkhatagāmimaggo.
segments.en: So, mendicants, I’ve taught you the unconditioned and the path that leads to the unconditioned.

segments.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hitesinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.
segments.en: Out of compassion, I’ve done what a teacher should do who wants what’s best for their disciples.

segments.pli: Etāni, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññāgārāni. Jhāyatha, bhikkhave, mā pamādattha; mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. Ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanīti. (1.1)
segments.en: Here are these roots of trees, and here are these empty huts. Practice absorption, mendicants! Don’t be negligent! Don’t regret it later! This is my instruction to you.”

segments.pli: Asaṅkhatañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi asaṅkhatagāmiñca maggaṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I will teach you the unconditioned and the path that leads to the unconditioned.
Listen …
And what is the unconditioned?
The ending of greed, hate, and delusion.
This is called the unconditioned.
And what is the path that leads to the unconditioned?
Discernment.
This is called the path that leads to the unconditioned. …”

segments.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, desitaṃ vo mayā asaṅkhataṃ … pe …

segments.en: “And what is the path that leads to the unconditioned?
Immersion with placing the mind and keeping it connected. …
Immersion without placing the mind, but just keeping it connected. …

segments.pli: Avitakko avicāro samādhi. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo … pe …. (1.3–5.)
segments.en: Immersion without placing the mind or keeping it connected. …
Emptiness immersion. …
Signless immersion. …

segments.pli: Appaṇihito samādhi. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo … pe …. (1.6–8.)
segments.en: Undirected immersion. …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: A mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world. …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vedanāsu vedanānupassī viharati … pe …
segments.en: A mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of feelings …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu citte cittānupassī viharati … pe …
segments.en: A mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the mind …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati … pe … ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo … pe …. (1.9–12.)
segments.en: A mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of principles …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anuppannānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ anuppādāya chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati.
segments.en: A mendicant generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts the mind, and strives so that bad, unskillful qualities don’t arise. …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati.
segments.en: A mendicant generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts the mind, and strives so that bad, unskillful qualities are given up. …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu anuppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ uppādāya chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati.
segments.en: A mendicant generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts the mind, and strives so that skillful qualities arise. …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu uppannānaṃ kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ṭhitiyā asammosāya bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya bhāvanāya pāripūriyā chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo … pe …. (1.13–16.)
segments.en: A mendicant generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts the mind, and strives so that skillful qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are fulfilled by development.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu chandasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti.
segments.en: A mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort. …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vīriyasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti.
segments.en: A mendicant develops the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cittasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti.
segments.en: immersion due to mental development …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vīmaṃsasamādhipadhānasaṅkhārasamannāgataṃ iddhipādaṃ bhāveti. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo … pe …. (1.17–20.)
segments.en: immersion due to inquiry, and active effort. …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddhindriyaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
segments.en: A mendicant develops the faculty of faith, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go. …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vīriyindriyaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ … pe …
segments.en: A mendicant develops the faculty of energy …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satindriyaṃ bhāveti … pe …
segments.en: mindfulness …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu samādhindriyaṃ bhāveti … pe …
segments.en: immersion …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paññindriyaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo … pe …. (1.21–25.)
segments.en: wisdom, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go. …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddhābalaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ … pe …
segments.en: A mendicant develops the power of faith …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vīriyabalaṃ bhāveti … pe …
segments.en: energy …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satibalaṃ bhāveti … pe …
segments.en: mindfulness …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu samādhibalaṃ bhāveti … pe …
segments.en: immersion …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu paññābalaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo … pe …. (1.26–30.)
segments.en: wisdom, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go. …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ … pe …
segments.en: A mendicant develops the awakening factor of mindfulness …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti … pe …
segments.en: investigation of principles …
energy …
rapture …
tranquility …
immersion …

segments.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ. Ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, asaṅkhatagāmimaggo … pe …. (1.31–37.)
segments.en: equanimity, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sammādiṭṭhiṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
segments.en: A mendicant develops right view …

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sammāsaṅkappaṃ bhāveti … pe …
segments.en: right thought …
right speech …
right action …
right livelihood …
right effort …
right mindfulness …

segments.pli: asaṅkhatañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi asaṅkhatagāmiñca maggaṃ.
Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sammāsamādhiṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
segments.en: right immersion, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
This is called the path that leads to the unconditioned.

segments.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, desitaṃ vo mayā asaṅkhataṃ, desito asaṅkhatagāmimaggo.
segments.en: So, mendicants, I’ve taught you the unconditioned and the path that leads to the unconditioned.

segments.pli: Yaṃ, bhikkhave, satthārā karaṇīyaṃ sāvakānaṃ hitesinā anukampakena anukampaṃ upādāya, kataṃ vo taṃ mayā.
segments.en: Out of compassion, I’ve done what a teacher should do who wants what’s best for their disciples.

segments.en: Here are these roots of trees, and here are these empty huts. Practice absorption, mendicants! Don’t be negligent! Don’t regret it later! This is my instruction to you.”
